summary:
**Meeting Overview**: The Economic Development Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on April 1, 2024, at 1:00 PM in the City Council Chambers and via videoconference. The meeting aims to discuss various economic development initiatives and upcoming agenda items.

**Key Agenda Items**: The meeting will include the approval of minutes from the March 4, 2024, Economic Development Committee meeting and a special joint meeting with the Workforce, Education, and Equity Committee. Additionally, there will be briefings on the Development Services Monthly Technology and Metrics.

**Important Details**: Significant proposals include a call for a public hearing on May 22, 2024, to renew the North Lake Highland and Prestonwood Public Improvement Districts and to expand the Dallas Tourism Public Improvement District to include an additional hotel. The committee will also discuss the appointment of replacement board members for the Dallas Development Fund.

**Action Items**: The committee seeks approval of the meeting minutes and is expected to make decisions regarding the upcoming public hearing and board member appointments. The meeting will also allow for discussions that may lead to executive sessions concerning legal advice, property negotiations, and economic development incentives. 

This meeting is open to the public, both in-person and virtually, with streaming available on local cable channels and online platforms.
